required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ventricular Arrhythmia Ablation With the Use of Non-Invasive ECG Imaging Technology
clinical_study.official_title: Saving Time During Ventricular Arrhythmia Ablation With the Use of Non-Invasive ECG Imaging Technology

brief_summary.textblock: Researchers are trying to determine if the use of software called VIVO, made by Catheter Precision, Inc. can shorten the length of time it takes to perform an ablation procedure for either premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) and ventricular tachycardia (VT).

clinical_study.why_stopped: Mutual decision between the investigators and the sponsor

primary_outcome.measure: Standard of care invasive electroanatomical mapping system duration
primary_outcome.description: Total amount of time for standard of care invasive mapping measured in minutes
Total amount of time for non-invasive mapping using VIVO measured in minutes

arm_group.description: Subjects presenting for PVC/VT ablation will undergo ablation procedures using standard of care invasive electroanatomical mapping systems.

Subjects presenting for PVC/VT ablation, that have a previously acquired cardiac CT/MRI scan or are having a cardiac CT/MRI scan as per routine care, will undergo ablation procedures using VIVO, a novel, non-invasive mapping system.

intervention.description: Non-invasive mapping system software product that combines patient-specific images (MRI or CT) of the torso and cardiac structures and a 3D image of the torso that identifies precise ECG lead placement to generate a 3D model of the patient's heart.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 18 years of age
- Structurally normal heart
- Cardiac MRI/CT as part of standard of care
- Diagnosed with premature ventricular contractions or ventricular tachycardia and scheduled to undergo an ablation to treat these conditions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than 18 years of age
- Structurally abnormal heart
